desc: [b'The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.']
name: [b'Albert Einstein']

desc: [b'It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.']
name: [b'J.K. Rowling']

desc: [b'There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.']
name: [b'Albert Einstein']

desc: [b'The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.']
name: [b'Jane Austen']

desc: [b"Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring."]
name: [b'Marilyn Monroe']

desc: [b'Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.']
name: [b'Albert Einstein']

desc: [b'It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.']
name: [b'Andr Gide']

desc: [b"I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work."]
name: [b'Thomas A. Edison']

desc: [b"A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water."]
name: [b'Eleanor Roosevelt']

desc: [b'A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.']
name: [b'Steve Martin']
